thread.title: SoMa skyscraper beam at risk of falling, forcing evacuation of 10 buildings

author: Roland Li
title: SoMa skyscraper beam at risk of falling, forcing evacuation of 10 buildings

organizations.name: san francisco business times share roland li reporter san francisco business times home

text: SoMa skyscraper beam at risk of falling, forcing evacuation of 10 buildings Feb 15, 2017, 4:01pm PST Industries & Tags Roland Li Reporter San Francisco Business Times Share Roland Li Reporter San Francisco Business Times Home of the Day See All Homes of the Day A loose concrete slab at an under-construction skyscraper in downtown San Francisco forced the evacuation of nine nearby buildings, the city's fire department said on Wednesday. The 2,000-pound slab at 41 Tehama St., a 403-unit developed by Hines, threatened to fall and damage nine neighboring buildings on Howard, Tehama and Second streets, which was being evacuated, the fire department said. The buildings being evacuated are 543, 531, 527, 505, 547, 555 and 557 Howard St., 235 Second St., as well as 44 and 41 Tehema St. itself. Lendlease is the general contractor for the building. Neither Lendlease nor Hines could immediately be reached for comment. Roland Li covers real estate and economic development ***EVACUATIONS***41 Tehema 30th floor loose concrete slab set 2k Lbs loose potential to fail AVOID AREA 41 Tehema being evacuated 254 Hrs pic.twitter.com/kAuoR0Otzn â€” San Francisco Fire (@sffdpio) February 15, 2017 Home of the Day
